Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw clearly distinct habitats, accurately depicting at least one land habitat (e.g., a garden or forest) and one water habitat (e.g., a pond or stream).
The student can include a variety of plants, such as trees, flowers, and grasses, and place them appropriately within each habitat.
The student can depict different types of animals, such as squirrels in the forest and fish in the pond, appropriately positioned within the habitats.
The student can show patterns by including similar and different living things in each habitat to illustrate diversity.
The student can structure their drawing to highlight the differences and similarities within and between the habitats.
CANNOT: The student might inconsistently label some animals or plants, occasionally leading to confusion about their habitat placement (e.g., a lizard labeled in the pond).

The student may show an incomplete variety of species within each habitat, focusing on more common or simple examples while omitting less obvious ones (e.g., including common trees and missing underrepresented species like bushes or clams).
